channel.title: Repeating stuff, New at java
channel.description: Hi i'm new on java and i'm figuring some thing out and testing some things, but there's one thing i really want to know: How do i repeat stuff every time again like server.java does? without using the server.java

item.title: Repeating stuff, New at java
item.dc:creator: @r.v.d.p r.v.d.p
item.description:
@r.v.d.p wrote:

ok, thats better, how do you set the timer?
i know this: public static int timer = 100;
but that isnt counting down to 0 so… what do i need to do to make it count to 0?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 04, 2007, 11:00:09 AM[/size][hr]plz anyone only that little thing i need to know :o [br][size=1]Posted on: June 04, 2007, 11:22:39 AM[/size][hr][quote=“zodi4k, post:6, topic:105890”]public void IDK() {
timer = 100;
}
if(timer == 0) {
action
timer = 100;
}[/quote]

it doesn’t work, it runs one time and then it stops, is there a way to let it count down automatic?

Read full topic

item.title: Repeating stuff, New at java
item.dc:creator: @zodi4k zodi4k
item.description:
@zodi4k wrote:

public void IDK() {
timer = 100;
}
if(timer == 0) {
action
timer = 100;
}

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Repeating stuff, New at java
item.dc:creator: @zodi4k zodi4k
item.description:
@zodi4k wrote:

You can use an int as timer but you can also use a loop

if(Action) {
ANOTHER ACTION
}
while(Action) {
AN Int + 1?
timer ++?
}

exmaple lOl sux but w/e

item.title: Repeating stuff, New at java
item.dc:creator: @r.v.d.p r.v.d.p
item.description:
@r.v.d.p wrote:

no, i mean i’ve made a whole new file, the file needs to be repeated ever type again, i need to know how i could make a file that is repeating that file over and over again, im now using server.java for doing that because server.java repeats every time again, so can anyone help plz?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 04, 2007, 09:54:18 AM[/size][hr]plz could onyone help?

Read full topic
